xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class TransformedKernelFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.KernelFunction
      xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.TransformedKernelFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Differentiable, Integrable, RealFunction
public class TransformedKernelFunction
extends KernelFunction
implements Integrable, Differentiable

This class provides a transformation of a one-dimensional kernel function with restricted support to [-1,1] like the epanechnikow kernel function or the biweight kernel function to an interval given by [l,l+c]. The transformed kernel function keeps its enclosed area of size 1 so one could use it to provide a difference kernel estimator. The used transformation is:

K_t (x)_I(x)[l,l+c] = (2/c) * K ( (2/c) * ( x - ( l + (c/2)) )_I(x)[-1,1]
= (2/c) K ( (2/c) (x-l) - 1 )_I(x)[-1,1]

This transformation preserves the area enclosed by the transformed kernel function, i.e. the integral \int_{l}^{l+c} K^t (t) dt == 1 for all l \in R and c >0 , c \in R.

See Also:
DifferenceKernelEstimator, KernelFunction, EpanechnikowKernel, BiweightKernel, TriweightKernel, CosineArchKernel

Constructs a new transformed kernel function based upon a given kernel function.

Parameters:
kernelFunction - one-dimensional kernel function with appropriate support to transform
l - left border of the target interval
c - width of the target interval
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if c <= 0
Method Detail

eval

public double eval(double x)
Evaluates the transformed kernel function at given point x. The transformation is performed by
K^t (t) = (2 /c) * K (x) with x = (2/c) * (t-l) - 1
or
K^t (t) = (2 /c) * K ( (2/c) * (t-l) - 1)
for l <= t <= l-c.
For t < l and t > l+c is K^t (t) == 0.

Specified by:
eval in interface RealFunction
Specified by:
eval in class KernelFunction
Parameters:
x - function argument where to evaluate the transformed kernel function
Returns:
function value of the transformed kernel function using the wrapped kernel function

primitive

public RealFunction primitive()
                       throws UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the primitive of the transformed kernel function if and only if the used kernel function for transformation itself implements the interface Integrable. Otherwise an UnsupportedOperationException occurs.
The primitive of the transformed kernel rests upon the primitive of the kernel used for transformation:
int_{l}^{a} K^t (t) dt = int{-1}^{(2/c)*( a - l) +1} K(x) dx
with l <= a <= l+c, a \in R.

Specified by:
primitive in interface Integrable
Returns:
primitive as RealFunction
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformed kernel function is not integrable

derivative

public RealFunction derivative()
                        throws UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the first derivative of the transformed kernel function if and only if the used kernel function for transformation itself implements the interface Differentiable. Otherwise an UnsupportedOperationException occurs.
The derivative of the transformed kernel rests upon the derivative of the kernel used for transformation:
K'^t (t) dt = (2 / c)^2 * K' ( (2/c)*(x-l) -1 ) for
l <= t <= l+c, t \in R
otherwise K'^t (t) = 0

Specified by:
derivative in interface Differentiable
Returns:
first derivative as RealFunction
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformed kernel function is not differentiable
